message.text: You cannot rest while monsters lurk!
You rest a moment to regain your breath.
You have eaten a poison ham. You drink a vial of green liquid, and suffer no ill effects.
You have sprung a dart trap.
You have sprung a blade trap.
You have sprung an arrow trap.
You use a set of thieves' tools to disarm the dart trap.
You use a set of thieves' tools to disarm the blade trap.
You use a set of thieves' tools to disarm the arrow trap.
You pick up a small pile of gemstones.
You have picked up a torch.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have picked up a torch. As light sources go, a torch is not the greatest, but it is better than nothing!

message.text: You have picked up a torch.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have picked up a lantern. A lantern is much better than a torch for providing light. It also lasts a great deal longer.

message.text: You have picked up a torch.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have picked up a magic lantern. It is the best light source you can find. Unfortunately, it is rare.

message.text: You have gained a new experience level!
The Amulet of Yendor you wear blocks the effects of the portal monster.
message.tutorial-description-text: As long as the amulet is worn, no portal monster can affect you.

message.text: The Amulet of Yendor you wear blocks the effects of the portal.
message.tutorial-description-text: You cannot leave while wearing the amulet.

message.text: You invoke the amulet of Yendor!
message.tutorial-description-text: You are wisked away to another part of the dungeon.

message.text: You have died. Press F2 to start a new game.
You have completed the Megaham! Now you need to find the exit!
The thief has taken a piece of the megaham!
The thief has taken gold from you!
The ghoul has drained energy from you!
You cannot enter a shoppe while creatures lurk!

message.tutorial-description-text: Congratulations. You won the game!

message.text: You can't leave without the complete megaham!
message.tutorial-description-text: You cannot leave without the complete Megaham!
You have killed a skeleton. Skeletons are the easiest of the undead to kill.
You have been killed by a skeleton, one of the weakest monsters in the game. I'd be embarrassed.
You have killed a zombie. Zombies are tougher than skeletons, but not as tough as mummies.
You have been killed by a zombie. It finds your brains tasty.
You have killed a mummy. Mummies are tougher than zombies, but not as tough as ghouls.
You have been killed by a mummy. You are the latest victim of the mummy's curse.
You have killed a ghoul. Ghouls are the toughest undead creatures.
You have been killed by a ghoul. It quietly digests your soul.
You have killed the necromancer.
You have been killed by the necromancer. This is strange, because he usually gets his work done through others.
You have killed a goblin.
You have been killed by a goblin. Considering how weak these creatures are, we'll just tell people that you were eaten by a grue, instead.
You have killed an orc.
You have been killed by an orc. He laughs at your misfortune.
You have killed a fimir.
You have been killed by a fimir. Tough luck.

message.text: You have hit a chaos warrior.
You have missed a chaos warrior.
You have killed a chaos warrior.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have killed a chaos warrior.
You have killed a chaos warrior. Zargon will be pleased.
You have killed a gargoyle.
You have been killed by a gargoyle. In your final moments, you regret ever owning a pet rock.
You have killed the summoner.
You have been killed by the summoner, which is strange because it is usually his minions that finish a person off....
You have killed the dragon, which is certainly not an easy thing to do.
You have been killed by the dragon! Don't worry... you aren't the first. Nor are you likely to be the last....
You have killed a thief.
You have been killed by a thief. Even now, he is looking through your pockets for change.
You have killed the minotaur.
You have been killed by the minotaur. Now you'll never make it out of the labyrinth alive!

message.text: You have hit a teleport monster.
You have missed a teleport monster.
You have killed a teleport monster.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have killed a portal monster.
You have been killed by a portal monster, which shouldn't be possible.

message.text: You have opened the red door.
You need a red key in order to open this door.
message.tutorial-description-text: This door is locked. You will need an appropriately colored key.

message.text: You have opened the yellow door.
You need a yellow key in order to open this door.
message.tutorial-description-text: This door is locked. You will need an appropriately colored key.

message.text: You have opened the green door.
You need a green key in order to open this door.
message.tutorial-description-text: This door is locked. You will need an appropriately colored key.

message.text: You have opened the cyan door.
You need a cyan key in order to open this door.
message.tutorial-description-text: This door is locked. You will need an appropriately colored key.

message.text: You have opened the blue door.
You need a blue key in order to open this door.
message.tutorial-description-text: This door is locked. You will need an appropriately colored key.

message.text: You have opened the magenta door.
You need a magenta key in order to open this door.
message.tutorial-description-text: This door is locked. You will need an appropriately colored key.

message.text: You have picked up a red key.
message.tutorial-description-text: This key obviously must go to a similarly colored door.

message.text: You have picked up a yellow key.
message.tutorial-description-text: This key obviously must go to a similarly colored door.

message.text: You have picked up a green key.
message.tutorial-description-text: This key obviously must go to a similarly colored door.

message.text: You have picked up a cyan key.
message.tutorial-description-text: This key obviously must go to a similarly colored door.

message.text: You have picked up a blue key.
message.tutorial-description-text: This key obviously must go to a similarly colored door.

message.text: You have picked up a magenta key.
message.tutorial-description-text: This key obviously must go to a similarly colored door.

message.text: You have picked up a dagger.
message.tutorial-description-text: A dagger is the least effective weapon (although still more effective than no weapon at all).

message.text: You have picked up a shortsword.
message.tutorial-description-text: A short sword is better than a dagger, but not as good as a long sword.

message.text: You have picked up a longsword.
message.tutorial-description-text: A long sword is better than a short sword, but not as good as a two handed sword.

message.text: You have picked up a two-handed sword.
message.tutorial-description-text: A two handed sword is better than a long sword, but not as good as a battle axe. You cannot use a two handed sword with a shield.

message.text: You have broken a two-handed sword.
You have picked up a battle axe.
message.tutorial-description-text: A battle axe is the best available weapon.

message.text: You have broken a battle axe.
You have picked up the Amulet of Yendor!
message.tutorial-description-text: You have picked up the fabled Amulet of Yendor!

message.text: You have picked up the raindbow key.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have picked up the rainbow key!

message.text: You have picked up thieves' tools.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have picked up a set of thieves' tools! They are useful for disarming traps, or picking your teeth.

message.text: You have picked up a vial of mysterious liquid.
message.tutorial-description-text: You have picked up a vial of mysterious liquid!

message.text: You have picked up a shield.
message.tutorial-description-text: A Shield is worn on your non-weapon hand. It adds 1 to your armor statistic. It cannot be combined with two handed weapons, so will not be in use while you have a two handed weapon while in attack mode. To change between attack and defend modes, press the Tab key.
A shield can only take so many hits and still be effective. The shield you were carrying too one hit too many.

message.text: You have picked up a helmet.
message.tutorial-description-text: A Helmet is worn on the head. It adds 1 to your armor statistic.

message.text: You have picked up a shirt of chainmail.
message.tutorial-description-text: Chainmail is worn on the torso, and so cannot be combined with Platemail. It adds 1 to your armor statistic, but also cuts your speed by a quarter.

message.text: You have broken a shirt of chainmail.
You have picked up a shirt of platemail.
message.tutorial-description-text: This is the heaviest armor in the game. It is worn on the torso, and so cannot be combined with Chainmail. It adds 2 to your armor statistic, but also cuts your speed in half.

message.text: You have broken a shirt of platemail.
You have picked up a pair of boots.
message.tutorial-description-text: This is a wonderfully made pair of boots. They make you feel light on your feet. While it doesn't add anything to your armor statistic, it does double your speed.

message.text: You have worn out a pair of boots.
You have picked up a lovely ham.
message.tutorial-description-text: This is a lovely ham. If you are at less than full health, you will automatically eat a ham to restore one health point. Think of it like having bonus health points.

message.text: You eat some ham to recover strength.
message.tutorial-description-text: Since you started to move with less than full health, you have eaten some ham to help restore strength.

message.text: You have picked up a crimson potion.
message.tutorial-description-text: Crimson potions are like extra lives. Whenever your character is about to die, he will drink a potion, which will restore up to 10 health points.

message.text: You quaff a potion in the nick of time, making you good as new.
message.tutorial-description-text: You were about to die. Fortunately, you had a potion handy - this time. Close call!

message.text: You have picked up a pile of copper pieces.
message.tutorial-description-text: A pile of copper coins can be worth anywhere from 1 to 5 Gold.

message.text: You have picked up a pile of silver pieces.
message.tutorial-description-text: A pile of silver coins can be worth anywhere from 6 to 25 Gold.

message.text: You have picked up a pile of gold pieces.
message.tutorial-description-text: A pile of gold coins can be worth anywhere from 26 to 50 Gold.

message.text: Gold has been stolen from you.
message.tutorial-description-text: Some creatures have a special attack of stealing Gold from you.

message.text: You have picked up a pile of electrum pieces.
message.tutorial-description-text: A pile of electrum coins can be worth anywhere from 51 to 100 Gold. (And yes, I know that Electrum in D&D was valued in between silver and gold... the picture of bluish coins was bigger than the gold picture. Deal with it!)

message.text: You have picked up a pile of platinum pieces.
message.tutorial-description-text: A pile of platinum coins can be worth anywhere from 101 to 200 Gold.

message.text: You have eaten a poison ham.
message.tutorial-description-text: Some enemies drop poison ham. Eating it will hurt you. However, I believe there is an antidote....

message.text: Comfort and safety warning: may cause repetitive stress injury after prolonged play.
Collect the 16 pieces of the MegaHam, then find the exit!
You have a small supply of food, a dagger, and a torch, but you will need other items to make it through
You use a set of thieves' tools to disarm the dart trap.
You have picked up a small bundle of amethysts.
You have been killed by a blade trap.
